sub_title: Engineering Coordinator at Combifloat Systems B.V.
summary:
Potete visualizzare il mio profilo anche in Italiano.

I am a dynamic and proactive Naval Architect and Marine Engineer, employed as Senior Engineer at INNOVO Mediterranean Services.

I am currently involved in the Subsea Well Response Project as Lead Field Engineer, directly working with the nine major Oil Companies (BP, CHEVRON, CONOCO PHILLIPS, EXXONMOBIL, PETROBRAS, SHELL, STATOIL, TOTAL) and Saipem technical staff.

At INNOVO Engineering and Construction, I was the technical coordinator of Aberdeen Engineering department, where, besides the engineering analyses in the subsea and marine field, my role required me to meet Clients (Saipem, Harkand, GdF, Doff Subsea, … ) project managers and technical staff in order to define Scope of Works, agreeing technical issues and editing Technical Offers for bids and tenders.

In my present role I am responsible for providing technical guidance and leadership to subordinates engineers and specialists.

Asides my technical competences I consider myself a self-motivated and organized individual.

projects:
[{'title': 'Subsea Well Response Project - Offset Installation Equipment', 'date': {'start': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 4, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'The Subsea Well Response Project (SWRP) is a non-profit joint initiative of nine major oil and
gas companies, established on the recommendation of the International Association of Oil and
Gas Producers (OGP), aiming at developing solutions to respond quickly and efficiently to future
subsea well-control incidents.
SWRP has assigned, through Oil Spill Response Ltd (OSRL) a contract to Saipem, Carubi and INNOVO for the engineering, procurement, fabrication and testing of the Offset Installation Equipment (OIE), a tool designed to install a capping stack on a blowout well without requiring direct vertical access.
This will allow supporting vessels to stay outside the zone in which it is unsafe to operate, i.e. the
Exclusion Zone.
The OIE utilizes a large subsea buoyant carrier structure to install the pre-designed capping
stack over the blowout well.

CLIENT: SAIPEM for PROJECT JOINT VENTURE AND CONSORTIUM SUBSEA WELL; OIL SPILL RE-SPONSE; SHELL; BP; CHEVRON; CONOCOPHILLIPS; EXXON; PETROBRAS; STATOIL; TOTAL.

CONTRACTOR: CARTUBI and INNOVO.
LOCATION: TRIESTE, ITALY - CARTUBI SHIPYARD

MAIN ACTIVITIES:

- Piping and flexible hoses (design and engineering, 3D model management, procurement, 
fabrication and installation supervision, modifications on the field)
- Piping and flexible hoses testing procedures (pressure and flushing tests)
- Carter for rigid piping (design and engineering, procurement, fabbrication and installation
supervision)
- Lifting procedure of assemblies and sub-assemblies (lifting analyses, calculation notes and field
supervision)
- Lifting Tools (design and engineering, procurement and fabbrication supervision)
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Francesco', 'last_name': 'Pettinà, CEng - MRINA', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Engineering Coordinator at Combifloat Systems B.V.'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Kay', 'last_name': 'Watutantrige Fernando', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Engineer at McDermott International Inc.'}, {'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Paolo', 'last_name': 'De Colle', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Project Engineer  presso Remazel Engineering'}]}, {'title': 'Shah Deniz 2', 'date': {'start': {'month': 1, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}, 'end': {'month': 2, 'day': None, 'year': 2016}}, 'description': 'Hydraulic and mechanic assembly supervision for 2-off Power Reel Drive System.
Client: Saipem for British Petroleum
Location: BOS Shelf Shipyard - Baku, Azerbaijan ', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Francesco', 'last_name': 'Pettinà, CEng - MRINA', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Engineering Coordinator at Combifloat Systems B.V.'}]}, {'title': 'Integrated ship design: hydrodynamic analysis and rudder geometry optimization of a RoRo-Pax.', 'date': {'start': {'month': 3, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}, 'end': {'month': 10, 'day': None, 'year': 2012}}, 'description': 'Master Thesis in Naval Architect and Marine Engineering:

The objective of this thesis was the analysis and modification of the rudder installed on the ship
Bithia owned by Tirrenia Compagnia Italiana di Navigazione and built by Fincantieri - Cantieri
Navali SpA.

It was a team work by four colleagues and we edited the parts of:

• Hydrodynamic analysis and geometry definition;
• Structural design
• Finite Element Analysis;
• Construction and detailing design.

I personally was in charge of the hydrodynamics, writing a Fortran program that allows the
rudders design taking into account the propeller, hull and rudder interaction, and the resulting
stream.

The whole project was focused on reducing the design time, using a single model created with
the software SmartMarine3D which is interfaced with all the design phases.
', 'contributors': [{'type': 'standardizedContributor', 'first_name': 'Francesco', 'last_name': 'Pettinà, CEng - MRINA', 'name': None, 'headline': 'Engineering Coordinator at Combifloat Systems B.V.'}]}]
